result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Zachary Berst

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for John Zachary Berst.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for adjourned hearing on Doctor's Report Return.  Parties review and do not contest the Doctor's Report dated 8/31/2022.  Competency hearing was held in Washington County Case 22CF275 wherein the Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  This Court adopts the findings of Judge Kenitz and orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services and referral for Out Patient Restoration Program in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.   Defendant is out of custody.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Review Hearing on Competency in Branch 9. Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Zachary Berst in court.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for John Zachary Berst.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Jon Josephsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Return on Doctor's Report. Parties do not contest the Doctor's Report dated 8/31/2022.  Court orders proceedings suspended.  Defendant is scheduled to appear in Washington County for Competency hearing on 10/19/2022. Court adjourns this matter to allow time for ruling on competency in Washington Co. Case.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
/of Dr. Jenna Goebel, Psy. D., dated 8/31/2022, filed.
/signed and filed.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for John Zachary Berst.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place with the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building via zoom videoconferencing with Dr. Niess on September 22, 2022 at 9:30 am.

Motion hearing currently scheduled for 9/15/2022 at 2:00 pm is vacated pending outcome of evaluation. Case remains calendared in Branch 9. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
/to Notice Competency, filed.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Defendant John Zachary Berst in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a motion hearing, defense filed a motion to suppress. State notifies Court that they cannot locate the officer witnesses. Court allows more time for the State to locate officers, as they are subpoenaed witnesses. State notifies Court that the officers are actively on an assignment and are unable to be relieved. State is requesting an adjournment of the motion hearing. Defense is prepared to proceed with the motion hearing and is objecting to an adjournment. Court grants the State's request for an adjournment for reasons placed on the record. Court sets 07/08/2022 as the deadline for the parties to file written notice to the Court of any witness unavailability for the 09/15/2022 motion hearing. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order to Produce
Order to Produce
Order to Produce
Order to Produce
Received and Filed. State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense filed a motion to suppress. Court set the following filing deadlines. State has until June 10th, 2022 to file a response to the defenses motion. Defense has until June 21st, 2022 to file a final reply. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following deadlines: Discovery Material (with the exception of Crime Lab Reports) is due by April 1st, 2022. Any Motions are due by May 6th, 2022. Court set continued pre-trial conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Substitution of Attorneys signed and filed.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Stipulation & Consent for Substitution of Attorneys.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019142,
Payable Number: 987280,
Receipt Number: 22RP007309,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant John Zachary Berst not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defendant is housed in the Ozaukee County Jail; his appearance was not scheduled with that institution for today. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant John Zachary Berst in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant John Zachary Berst in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Zachary Berst appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
